command: try { $key=$env:WHOISXML_API_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key)){ throw 'Missing WHOISXML_API_KEY'; }; $uri="https://www.whoisxmlapi.com/whoisserver/WhoisService?apiKey=$key&domainName=example.com&outputFormat=JSON"; $resp=Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $uri -Headers @{Accept='application/json'} -TimeoutSec 25 -ErrorAction Stop; $resp | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\ti_t1597.log" -Value ("[WhoisXML] " + $_.Exception.Message) }
explanation: Pulls WHOIS data for example.com from WhoisXML, a commercial closed-source service. Utilizes HTTPS and parameterized API key; returns JSON.
rationale_steps: Obtain API key from environment and construct a minimal GET request.
Leverage trusted vendor endpoint over TLS with JSON output.
Use timeout and error handling to avoid noisy retries.
Convert results to JSON and log any exceptions.
